servinfo.title: “AIR BAG” Warning Lamp Does Not Come ON

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to “AIR BAG” Warning Lamp Comes ON Steady .

attention2.ptxt: Be sure to observe instructions under CAUTION in “Air Bag Diagnostic System Check Flow”.

ptxt.emph: Step 1: Check combination meter power feed circuit.
Step 2: Check “AIR BAG” warning lamp circuit.

test1.ptxt: Note combination meter when ignition switch is turned ON.

testgroup.question: Does the “BRAKE” indicator (warning lamp) come ON?

action.ptxt: Check and correct the following possible cause. • Open circuit in “BLK/YEL” or “PPL/RED” wire. • Short circuit between “BLK/YEL” or “PPL/RED” and ground. • “METER” fuse blown.

test1.ptxt: Note combination meter when ignition switch is turned ON.

testgroup.question: Does the “AIR BAG” warning lamp come ON?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good SDM and recheck.
“YEL/BLK” circuit shorted to power circuit. If OK, replace combination meter.

attention3.ptxt: Upon completion of inspection and repair work, perform the following items.

item.ptxt: Reconnect all air bag system components and ensure all components are properly mounted.
Repeat Air Bag Diagnostic System Check to confirm that the trouble has been corrected.
